DataElement.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Radiation Therapy Medical Contraindication Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the reason free-text field to specify the connective tissue disorder, a heterogeneous group of disorders characterized by abnormal structure or function of one or more of the elements of connective tissue, as the medical contraindication, any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body, as a follow-up to breast conservation treatment, excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissu,  inadvisable.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Radiation Therapy Medical Contraindication
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation, as a follow-up to breast conservation treatment, excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, being medically contraindicated, any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990):use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk.

Concepts.definition: A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation why radiation therapy was medically contraindicated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the connective tissue.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the connective tissue.
An indicator that a person previously received radiation treatment for the same condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
